title: Asking for a carpool
context: Ask a coworker if you can ride together to save money on gas.

content.bestLine: Want to carpool to work and split gas costs?

neutral.text: Do you want to ride together to work?
We could carpool and save on gas.
Would you like to carpool with me?
Let's carpool to work and reduce expenses.
Is carpooling to work an option for you?
We could split gas costs if we carpool.
Carpooling could be a great way to save money.

informal.text: Hey, want to ride to work together?
We should totally carpool to work!
You wanna carpool and save some cash?
Let's grab a ride to work together!
Ride with me to work and we'll split gas?
Carpooling would be so much more fun with you!
Want to team up for the commute?

formal.text: I was wondering if we could arrange a carpool to work.
Would you be interested in carpooling to the office?
Carpooling could be a beneficial arrangement for both of us.
I propose we explore the option of carpooling to work.
If you're willing, we could discuss a carpooling schedule.
Carpooling would be a prudent decision, considering the costs.

patterns.meaning: Asking someone to share a commute
Suggesting a shared commute for financial benefits

lines.speaker: John
lines.text: Hey, want to ride to work together?

lines.speaker: Emily
lines.text: That sounds like a great idea. I've been looking for ways to save on gas.

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.text: I was thinking we could carpool to work. Would you be interested?

lines.speaker: Sarah
lines.text: Yes, that would be wonderful. My car is available if you'd like to drive together.
